<td align="left" valign="top" width="90%">

<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><!--EFPlaceholder-->PART I</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Item 1.&#160;&#160;Description of 
Business</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Forward-Looking Statements</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">This annual report contains forward-looking statements that involve risks
and uncertainties. These statements relate to future events or our future 
financial performance. In some cases, you can identify forward-looking 
statements by terminology including "could", "may", "will", "should", "expect", 
"plan", "anticipate", "believe", "estimate", "predict", "potential" and the 
negative of these terms or other comparable terminology. These statements are 
only predictions.&#160;&#160;Actual events or results may differ 
materially.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">While these forward-looking statements, and any assumptions upon which 
they are based, are made in good faith and reflect our current judgment 
regarding the direction of our business, actual results will almost always vary,
sometimes materially, from any estimates, predictions, projections, assumptions 
or other future performance suggested in this report. Except as required by 
applicable law, we do not intend to update any of the forward-looking statements
so as to conform these statements to actual results.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Presentation of Information</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">As used in this annual report, the terms "we", "us", "our" and the 
&#8220;Company&#8221; mean Buckingham Exploration Inc. and its subsidiaries, 
unless the context requires otherwise.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">All dollar amounts in this annual report refer to US dollars unless 
otherwise indicated.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On July 23, 2010, we completed a reverse split of our shares of common 
stock on a 1-for-400 basis. All share amounts in this annual report are 
presented on a post-split basis, unless otherwise indicated.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Overview</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We were incorporated as a Nevada company on April 4, 2006. We have been 
engaged in the acquisition and exploration of mineral properties since our 
inception. We have not generated any revenues and have incurred losses since 
inception.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We currently own options to acquire a 100% interest in two mineral 
properties, the Lady Ermalina and Dome mineral properties, located in the 
Province of British Columbia, Canada. We have not conducted any material 
exploration work on our mineral properties and none of our properties has been 
determined to contain any mineral resources or reserves of any 
kind.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="25%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px outset; TEXT-ALIGN:

<td valign="top" width="25%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px outset; TEXT-ALIGN:

</td>
<td valign="top" width="25%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px outset; TEXT-ALIGN:

</td>
</tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>
</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: arial">Exploration permit has been obtained.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr bgcolor="white">
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: arial">Dome Claims</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: arial">Beaverdell Area, Greenwood Mining Division in British Columbia, 
Canada</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: arial">An option to acquire 100% interest.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="middle" width="25%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: arial">Exploration permit has been obtained.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We previously owned interests in two mineral properties located in the 
State of Colorado, the High Park mineral property and the Proteus mineral 
property, which we transferred to a debentureholder in August 2009 in settlement
of amounts owing to our debentureholders.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Our plan of operations for the next 12 months is to explore our mineral 
properties. We plan to begin by conducting a small exploration project on each 
of our properties in the next month involving mapping and property surveys, 
among other things, at a cost of approximately $10,000 per property. We 
anticipate we will require approximately $0.5 million to carry out any further 
exploration plans over the next 12 months. As at May 31, 2010, we had cash of 
$2,194 and a working capital deficit of $374,038 and will require significant 
financing to pursue our exploration plans. There can be no assurance that we 
will obtain the required financing, on terms acceptable to us or at all. In the 
event we are unable to obtain the required financing, our business may fail. An 
investment in our securities involves significant risks and you could lose your 
entire in
vestment.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">2</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Development of Business</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We were incorporated under the laws of the State of Nevada in April 2006.
In June 2007, we acquired the High Park mineral property through our wholly-
owned subsidiary High Park Uranium Inc, which consisted of 29 unpatented mineral
claims located in the State of Colorado. In January 2008, we acquired the 
Proteus mineral property through our wholly-owned subsidiary Alpha Beta Uranium 
Inc, which consisted of 419 unpatented lode mining claims also located in the 
State of Colorado.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On September 24, 2008, we entered into secured convertible debenture 
purchase agreements with three investors pursuant to which we sold three 
convertible debentures to the investors in the aggregate amount of $500,000 and 
we also granted to them warrants to purchase up to an aggregate of 12,500 shares
of our common stock at an exercise price of $0.40 per share exercisable for a 
period of 2 years. The debentures accrued interest at a rate of 10% per annum 
and were convertible into shares of our common stock at a price of $20 per 
share. As collateral security, we granted the investors a security interest in 
all the right, title and interest of all of our present and future 
assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">On June 5, 2009, we entered into agreements
with the debentureholders to issue an </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">aggregate of 8,455 shares of common stock to 
settle interest accrued up to May 31, 2009. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">On June 25, 2009, we issued an aggregate of
2,536 restricted shares of common stock </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">to a debentureholder to settle interest 
accrued up to May 31, 2009 in the amount of $10,146. </font><font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Subsequent</font> to May 31, 2010, we<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">issued a further 
5,918 restricted shares of common stock to two </font><font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">debentureholders to settle interest
accru
ed in the amount of $23,674.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On August 27, 2009, we entered into a settlement agreement with one of 
the debentureholders, subsequent to an event of default under the terms of the 
debentures, to settle the outstanding debenture in the amount of $150,000 plus 
accrued interest. Under the terms of the settlement agreement, we agreed to 
transfer all of our interest in our wholly-owned subsidiaries, Hyde Park Uranium
Inc. and Alpha Beta Uranium Inc., to the debentureholder along with all of our 
property and equipment and intellectual property rights related to these 
properties. The debentureholder agreed to pay us $50,000 and had the other two 
debentures in the aggregate amount of $350,000 assigned to it.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">In October 2009, we completed the transfer all our interest in the High 
Park and Proteus properties to Regal Uranium pursuant to the settlement 
agreement. See &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial 
Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; for more information relating to the 
debentures.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On January 29, 2010, we entered into an option agreement (the &#8220;Lady
Ermalina Option Agreement&#8221;) with Argus Metals Corp. (&#8220;Argus&#8221;) 
in relation to three mining claims known as the Lady Ermalina Chemainus Claims 
located on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada (the &#8220;Lady Ermalina 
Property&#8221;).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Pursuant to the Lady Ermalina Option Agreement, we agreed to issue an 
aggregate of 1,500 shares of our common stock and to pay an aggregate of $5,000 
in cash in consideration for the grant of the sole and exclusive right and 
option to acquire a 100% undivided interest in the Lady Ermalina Property. 
Further, we agreed to incur not less than $600,000 in expenditures related to 
exploration and development on the Lady Ermalina Property before January 6, 
2012. We issued 250 shares to Argus under the Lady Ermalina Option Agreement in 
February 2010.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On July 9, 2010, we received stockholder approval to effect a one-for-
four hundred reverse stock split of our issued and outstanding common stock, 
which would take effect upon FINRA approval. The number of shares that we are 
authorized to issue did not change as a result of the reverse stock 
split.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On July 22, 2010, we received approval from FINRA and the reverse stock 
split took effect on July 23, 2010.&#160;&#160;On the effective date of the 
reverse split , the Company&#8217;s trading symbol was changed from 
&#8220;BUKX&#8221; to &#8220;BUKXD&#8221; for approximately 20 business days 
after which it reverted to BUKX.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On August 23, 2010, 0887717 B.C. Ltd. (&#8220;0887717&#8221;), our 
wholly-owned subsidiary which we incorporated in British Columbia, Canada on 
August 9, 2010, entered into an option agreement (the &#8220;Dome Option
Agreement&#8221;) with Murray Scott Morrison, pursuant to which 0887717 has the 
right to acquire 100% interest in the mineral property known as the Dome Claim 
Group located on Mount Vallace in the Beaverdell Area, Greenwood Mining Division
in the Province of British Columbia, Canada (the &#8220;Dome 
Property&#8221;).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">In accordance with the provisions of the Dome Option Agreement, 0887717 
paid $5,000 to Mr. Morrison on the date of the agreement, is required to incur 
not less than $10,000 in expenditures related to exploration and development on 
the Dome Property prior to September 30, 2010 and is required to pay $1,000 to 
Mr. Morrison on or before November 30, 2010. Pursuant to the terms of the Dome 
Option Agreement, 0887717 granted to Mr. Morrison stock options (the 
&#8220;Stock Options&#8221;) to purchase up to 10% of its total issued and 
outstanding share capital at a total price of $1.00, which may be exercised when
a probable mineral reserve is discovered on the property.&#160;&#160;The Stock 
Options expire 36 months after the date of the Dome Option 
Agreement.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">3</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Subsidiaries</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We currently have one wholly-owned subsidiary, 0887717 BC Ltd. which is 
incorporated under the laws of the Province of British Columbia, 
Canada.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Competition</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We are an exploration stage mineral resource exploration company that 
competes with other mineral resource exploration companies for financing and for
the acquisition of new mineral properties.&#160;&#160;Many of the mineral 
resource exploration companies with whom we compete have greater financial and 
technical resources than those available to us.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, these 
competitors may be able to spend greater amounts on acquisitions of mineral 
properties of merit, on exploration of their mineral properties and on 
development of their mineral properties.&#160;&#160;In addition, they may be 
able to afford more geological expertise in the targeting and exploration of 
mineral properties.&#160;&#160;This competition could result in competitors 
having mineral properties of greater quality and interest to prospective 
investors who may finance ad
ditional exploration and development.&#160;&#160;This competition could 
adversely impact on our ability to achieve the financing necessary for us to 
conduct further exploration of our mineral properties.&#160;&#160;We also 
compete with other mineral exploration companies for financing from a limited 
number of investors that are prepared to make investments in mineral exploration
companies.&#160;&#160;The presence of competing mineral exploration companies 
may impact on our ability to raise additional capital in order to fund our 
exploration programs if investors are of the view that investments in 
competitors are more attractive based on the merit of the mineral properties 
under investigation and the price of the investment offered to 
investors.&#160;&#160;We also compete with other mineral companies for available
resources, including, but not limited to, professional geologists, camp staff, 
mineral exploration supplies and drill rigs.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Intellectual Property</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We currently do not own any intellectual property other than copyright in
the contents of our website, www.buckinghamexploration.com.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Research and Development Expenditures</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We have not engaged in any research and development activities since our 
inception.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Environmental Laws</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Mineral resource exploration, production and related operations are 
subject to extensive rules and regulations of federal, provincial, state and 
local agencies.&#160;&#160;Failure to comply with these rules and regulations 
can result in substantial penalties.&#160;&#160;Our cost of doing business may 
be affected by the regulatory burden on the mineral 
industry.&#160;&#160;Although we intend to substantially comply with all 
applicable laws and regulations, because these rules and regulations frequently 
are amended or interpreted, we cannot predict the future cost or impact of 
complying with these laws.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Environmental enforcement efforts with respect to mineral operations have
increased over the years, and it is possible that regulations could expand and 
have a greater impact on future mineral exploration 
operations.&#160;&#160;Although our management intends to comply with all 
legislation and/or actions of local, provincial, state and federal governments, 
non-compliance with applicable regulatory requirements could subject us to 
penalties, fines and regulatory actions, the costs of which could materially 
adversely affect our results of operations and financial 
condition.&#160;&#160;We cannot be sure that our proposed business operations 
will not violate environmental laws in the future.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Our operations and properties are subject to extensive federal, state, 
provincial and local laws and regulations relating to environmental protection, 
including the generation, storage, handling, emission, transportation and 
discharge of materials into the environment, and relating to safety and 
health.&#160;&#160;These laws and regulations may (i) require the acquisition of
a permit or other authorization before exploration commences, (ii) restrict the 
types, quantities and concentration of various substances that can be released 
in the environment in connection with exploration activities, (iii) limit or 
prohibit mineral exploration on certain lands lying within wilderness, wetlands 
and other protected areas, (iv) require remedial measures to mitigate pollution 
from former operations and (v) impose substantial liabilities for pollution 
resulting 
from our proposed operations.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">There are no costs to us at the present time in connection with 
compliance with environmental laws.&#160;&#160;However, since we do anticipate 
engaging in natural resource projects, these costs could occur and any 
significant liability could materially adversely affect our business, financial 
condition and results of operations.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">4</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Employees</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We have no part time or full time employees, other than our sole officer.
We do not intend to hire any employees until our financial condition 
improves.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Item 1A.&#160;&#160;Risk Factors</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Not Applicable.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Item 1B.&#160;&#160;Unresolved Staff 
Comments</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">None.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Item 2.&#160;&#160;Properties</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">We lease premises, at the rate of $1,073 per month, located at Suite 418-
831 Royal Gorge Blvd, Ca&#241;on City, Colorado 81212, from where we oversee our
business activities.&#160;&#160;During the year ended May 31, 2010, we 
terminated a lease for an additional facility located in Burnaby, British 
Columbia, Canada.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Lady Ermalina Chemainus Claims (the &#8220;Lady 
Ermalina Claims&#8221;)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On January 6, 2010, we entered into the Lady Ermalina Option Agreement 
with Argus Metals Corp. in relation to three mining claims known as the Lady 
Ermalina Chemainus Claims located on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, 
Canada.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Location</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">The Lady Ermalina Chemainus group of claims consists of approximately 550
hectares of British Columbia MTO mineral claims located approximately 11 
kilometres SW of Ladysmith, B.C. in the Victoria Mining Division.&#160;&#160;The
Project covers a NW trending section of the Mt. Sicker formation with a strong 
exploration potential for VMS Copper/Lead/Zinc deposits.&#160;&#160;These claims
cover the old Lady A, B and C showings that were drilled for magnetite in 1953 
and host the Project&#8217;s focus the &#8220;Iron Formation</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Figure 1:&#160;&#160;Location of Lady Ermalina 
Claims on Vancouver Island, British Columbia.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><img 
src="figure1.jpg" alt=""></font></font></div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">5</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Ownership 
Interest</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">In January 2010, we entered into the Lady Ermalina Option Agreement with 
Argus Metals Corp. providing us with the option to earn a 100% interest (subject
to a 2% NSR in favor of Argus Metals Corp.) in this project by:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#9679;</font>&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">paying $5,000 on the date of execution of the agreement 
(completed);</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#9679;</font>&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">issuing to Argus Metals Corp. a total of 1,500 common shares (250 issued 
and 1,250 shares to be issued on or before two years from the date of execution 
of the agreement); and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#9679;</font>&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">incurring not less than $600,000 in expenditures on the property prior to
January 6, 2012.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Argus Metals Corp. retains a 2.0% NSR, of which we can acquire 1.0% by 
making a payment to Argus in the sum of $1,000,000.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">History of 
Operations</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">The Lady Ermalina "Iron Formation" has been re-interpreted as a possible 
exhalative from a massive sulphide ore zone at depth, as is common in the New 
Brunswick camp.&#160;&#160;The thickness of the zone in the Lady C area (up to 
46 metres thick) in horizontal drill holes across the steeply dipping 
mineralization suggests the possibility of economic size to the 
zone.&#160;&#160;This section is 1.5 kilometres NW of, and on strike with, the 
Randy North Zone discovered by Laramide Resources Ltd. and five kilometres NW of
the Coronation zone which has a reported resources. These deposits, and the Mt. 
Sicker Mine which is 13 kilometres SE, are all in the Paleozoic Sicker 
formation, of equivalent age to the Myra Falls formation hosting the Breakwater 
deposits including the large VMS high grade HW ore body now operated by 
Breakwater Resources Ltd. The 
Lady showing is easily accessible by logging roads for a drill 
program.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">The 1953 drilling program consisted of twenty AX core holes totalmg 
2280.5 feet (695 m), of which 12 drill holes were on the Lady A, 4 on the Lady B
and 4 on the Lady C showing.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Massive sulphide copper was produced from Mt Sicker deposits, 13km SE of 
the Lady deposit, between 1898 and 1907 when two copper smelters were in 
operation at Ladysmith and Crofton and again between 1944-
45.&#160;&#160;Laramide R sources discovered the Coronation Zone in 1984, which 
lies approximately 5 km SE of the Lady Claims.&#160;&#160;Laramide drilled over 
200 holes and also conducted exploration work on a new discovery, the Randy 
North Zone, which lies 1.5Km SE of the Lady zone and trends on strike with the 
Lady C zone.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Present 
Condition of the Property and Current State of Exploration</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">To date there has no been drilling or trenching between the Lady A and 
Lady C showings or south of the Lady C to prove this continuity.&#160;&#160;The 
&#8220;iron formation&#8221; consists of lenses of extremely fine-grained 
magnetite with minor specular hematite in grey chert and red jasperoid rock. 
Some pyrite is present in talus south of the Lady C zone.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">In 1988 a soil sampling program consisting of 871 soil samples collected 
at 25 and 50 meter intervals on lines 100 meters apart in a NE-SW orientation 
was conducted.&#160;&#160;52 rock samples were also collected and all samples 
were analyzed by Acme Laboratories using 30 element ICP. In general the soil 
sampling shows moderately anomalous gold, silver, copper, lead, zinc and arsenic
in the vicinity of the &#8220;iron formation&#8221; with a gap in the sampling 
where the topography in the vicinity of the Lady C showing was too 
steep.&#160;&#160;Both soil and rock samples from the iron formation area were 
anomalous in molybdenum.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">A VLF-EM survey was run by Ashworth Exploration in 1987 over a southern 
grid with conductors appearing both NE and SW of the &#8220;iron 
formation&#8221;.&#160;&#160;In-phase readings only were recorded and the power 
line through the property had a disruptive effect.&#160;&#160;The magnetometer 
survey was run using a singma proton magnetometer but no base readings were 
taken.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">The magnetic profiles show strong peaks over the iron formation but again
readings could not be taken within 200 meters of the power lines.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">The Project requires a detailed compilation program to bring together the
entirety of the historic exploration work to date.&#160;&#160;Once that has been
accomplished, an on-the-ground property survey is required to locate the 
historic exploration areas drillholes.&#160;&#160;Subsequent to this, a drilling
program is envisioned to test the continuity of the iron formation between the 
Lady A and Lady C showings.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">6</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Geology</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">Regional mapping by GSC (Muller, 1980) shows the area of the Lady Claims 
to be underlain by Paleozoic Sicker Group which is intruded to the NE by the 
dioritic Ladysmith Stock of Jurassic Intrusions. The Pennsylvanian to 
Mississipian argillites, greywackes and cherts which underlie&#160;&#160;the 
Property are intruded by diabase sills. The southern part of the Property is 
underlain by the Lower Devonian or older Myra Formation consisting of felsic 
tuff and breccias, argillites, rhyodacite flows and phyllites. The Iron 
formation strikes NW at 45 to 60 degrees East and dips steeply with average 
thicknesses of 30 feet (10m) up to 160feet (50m).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Figure 2:&#160;&#160;Geology of Lady Ermalina 
Clams</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><img 
src="figure2.jpg" alt=""></div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">7</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Dome Claim Group Property (the &#8220;Dome 
Claims&#8221;)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On August 23, 2010, through our wholly owned subsidiary&#160;0887717 B.C.
Ltd., we entered into the Dome Option Agreement, pursuant to which we have the 
right to acquire 100% interest in mining claims known as Dome Claim Group 
located on Mount Vallace in Beaverdell Area, Greenwood Mining Division in 
British Columbia, Canada.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">Location</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Figures 3 and 4: Location of the Dome Claims in 
Beaverdel Area, British Columbia.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><img src="figure3.jpg" alt=""></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><img src="figure4.jpg" alt=""></div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">8</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Ownership 
Interest</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">On August 23, 2010, 0887717 B.C. Ltd., our wholly owned subsidiary, 
entered into the Dome Option Agreement with Murray Scott Morrison, pursuant to 
which 0887717 has the right to acquire a 100% interest in the mineral property 
known as the Dome Claim Group located on Mount Vallace in the Beaverdell Area, 
Greenwood Mining Division in the Province of British Columbia, 
Canada.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">In accordance with the provisions of the Dome Option Agreement, 0887717 
paid $5,000 to Mr. Morrison on the date of the agreement, is required to incur 
not less than $10,000 in expenditures related to exploration and development on 
the Dome Property prior to September 30, 2010 and is required to pay $1,000 to 
Mr. Morrison on or before November 30, 2010. Pursuant to the terms of the Dome 
Option Agreement, 0887717 granted to Mr. Morrison Stock Options to purchase up 
to 10% of its total issued and outstanding share capital at a total price of 
$1.00, which may be exercised when a probable mineral reserve is discovered on 
the property.&#160;&#160;The Stock Options expire 36 months after the date of 
the Dome Option Agreement.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">History of 
Operations</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">The Dome property is comprised of sixteen mineral claims covering 
approximately 360 hectares (890 acres), located&#160;&#160;four (4) kilometreres
southeast of Beaverdell, B.C. in the heart of the historic Beaverdell Mining 
Camp. The Dome mineral claims cover the historic workings of the Nepanee 
prospect that, according to the B. C. Minister of Mines Annual Reports, was 
worked intermittently between 1904 to 1935.&#160;&#160;In more recent years, 
sulphide mineralization including galena and sphalerite has been located near 
the old workings.&#160;&#160;The property is accessible by logging 
roads.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Present 
Condition of the Property and Current State of Exploration</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">No material exploration work has been carried out on the Dome Property. A
sampling and drilling program was conducted in 1989, however the property was 
determined to be uneconomical due to the the price of gold at the time. A small 
mapping project was undertaken on the property in 2009 to prepare the ground for
further work.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">The property will require prospecting and geological mapping on the 
western edge of the Dome property where granodiorite is known to outcrop with 
concentration on known skarn zones and mineralized shear zones that were 
followed with underground workings on several of the old properties that lie 
immediately west of the Dome property.&#160;&#160;Such old workings include 
those on District Lots 1091s, 1195s and 2939. Further mapping of the Tertiary 
cover on the eastern portion of the property will also be conducted in an 
attempt to determine the thickness of the cover.&#160;&#160;All known historic 
work will be compiled into a single system at a scale of at least 1:2500 and 
cross sections prepared for selected target areas.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Regional 
Geology</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
48pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">The Dome Property lies in the western portion of the Boundary District of
south central British Columbia and is centred within south the historic 
Beaverdell Mining Camp.&#160; In broad terms the area is a graben-derived 
terrane consisting of Triassic-Jurassic volcanics and sediments enclosed within 
and/or intruded by Jurassic-Cretaceous and Tertiary granitic rocks.&#160; 
Regionally, the Dome Project lies near the southern end of the Omineca
Crystalline Belt.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
48pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
48pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;The Boundary District is situated within the mid-Jurassic accreted 
Quesnellia terrane.&#160; Pre-existing Proterozoic to Palaeozoic North American 
basement rocks do however exist within the rafted Quesnellia terrane (Kettle and
Okanagan metamorphic core complexes).&#160; During the Eocene, these core 
complexes were uplifted separated from the overlying lithologies.&#160; The 
oldest of the accreted rocks in the district are the Pre-Jurassic Wallace 
Formation.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
48pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">9</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
105pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
105pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial">Broadly speaking, the lithologies (and general ages) are broken 
into the following Formations and units:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
105pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" 
width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial">1.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial">Wallace Formation [Pre-Jurassic - Quesnellia 
Terrane]</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" 
width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 63pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Arial">a.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Arial">Wallace Formation undivided</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent"

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 63pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">

</td>
<td align="left">

Arial">Crouse Creek Greenstone Member</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent"

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 63pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

</td>
<td align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

Arial">Larse Creek Limestone Member</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent"

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">

<td align="left">

</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent"

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">

</td>
<td align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" 
width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 63pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

</td>
<td align="left">
